node.text:
More than half of 7-16-year-olds in Niger are out of school. This scheme is going to get them learning again. 

Discover more about Africa's COVID-19 recovery by tapping the link in our bio #niger #africa #school #education #learning

node.title: In Niger, 99% of 10-year-olds can’t read and understand a short story

node.text:
Is your job mentally demanding? If so, you might thank yourself later in life 

Learn other techniques to keep your mind healthy as you age by tapping the link in our bio #dementia #jobs #science

node.title: You’re less likely to get dementia if you have a stimulating job

node.text:
Only 1 in 5 people with hypertension have it under control.

Learn more about the global health issues we face this year by tapping the link in our bio #health #healthcare #hypertension #medical #science

node.title: More than 1 billion have it. So what is hypertension?

node.text:
17.8% of all deaths from air pollution in 2019 were on India. 

Learn more about the effects of air pollution in the country by tapping the link in our bio #india #airpollution #environment #sustainability #health

But 37% of the planet’s sharks and rays are threatened with extinction.

node.accessibility_caption:
The Navya bus is spotted at the Munich Motor Show IAA Mobility 2021 

The event showcases the latest innovations in transport, with sustainability being at the forefront of this year's offerings. The Navya bus is a smart, self-driving shuttle that can transport up to 15 passengers on public or private roads. Many companies and cities around the world are already using Navya buses to cater to their mobility needs. 

#transport #travel #sustainability #innovation #technology 

REUTERS/Michaela Rehle

node.text:

node.accessibility_caption:
A man paddles through scorching temperatures as a heatwave hits Brittany, France. 

Temperatures in the are expected to reach almost 40°C early this week before storms set in from Wednesday onwards. 

#france #heatwave #extremeweather #paddleboarding #environment 

REUTERS/Pascal Rossignol

node.text:
A man paddles through scorching temperatures as a heatwave hits Brittany, France. 

Temperatures in the region are expected to reach almost 40°C early this week before storms set in from Wednesday onwards. 

#france #heatwave #extremeweather #paddleboarding #environment 

REUTERS/Pascal Rossignol

It could also generate water in Earth's most arid regions.

node.accessibility_caption:
The Tokyo Paralympic Games come to a spectacular close. 

13 days of non-stop sporting action gripped audiences around the world, with almost 5,000 athletes taking part. 

Which sport did you enjoy watching the most? 

#tokyo2020 #paralympics #sport #disabilityinclusion #tokyo 

REUTERS/Molly Darlington
